column2: Unit Title
Records of meetings and activities leading up to the first Convention, September 6, 1789-April 15, 1790
Copy of circular letter sent to Universalist societies seeking opinion on the calling of a convention, October 6, 1789. Printed in Richard Eddy, Universalism in America, Vol. 1, pp. 196-294
Letter from Universalist Society in Boston, December 6, 1789, in reply to circular letter. Signed by Shippie Townsend, John Murray, and George Richards
Letter from Universalist Church of Christ in Newbritain, Bucks County, Pennsylvania, c. May 1790
Letter from Universalists in Pilesgrove and Penns Neck,Salem County, New Jersey, c. May 1790
Letter from Universalist congregation in Frederick County, Virginia, May 1, 1790
Letter from Universalist Society in Boston, May 9, 1790
Letter from Universalists in Cohansey (Shilo), Cumberland County, New Jersey, May 23, 1790
Letter from Universalist Church in Kingwood, New Jersey, May 15, 1791
Letter from Universalist Church in Newbritain, Pennsylvania, May 15, 1791
Letter from Universalist Church in Cape May County, New Jersey, May 20, 1791
Letter from Universalist Church in Shilo, New Jersey, May 22, 1791
Letter from Universalist Church in Upper Freehold, Monmouth County, New Jersey, May 22, 1791
Letter from Universalist Church in Philadelphia,May 24(?), 1791

Copy of letter from James Moore, approved by the Convention, to answer an inquiry on the Convention's theory of future punishment made by Rev. Mr. Pollard of Maryland, May 28, 1791. Printed in Eddy, Universalism in America, Vol. 1, pp. 349-351
Report of committee to select and publish a collection of hymns, November 3, 1791. Includes list of hymns selected
Copy of letter from the committee to select and publish a collection of hymns to the committee of the Universalist Society in Boston, January 3, 1792
Letter from George Richards, probably to James Moore,February 25, 1792. Includes discussion of the selection of hymns from the collection to be published by the Philadelphia Universalist Convention
Letter from Universalist Church in Upper Freehold, New Jersey, April 14, 1792
Letter from Universalist Church in Pike Run, Washington County, Pennsylvania, May 2, 1792
Letter from Universalist Church in Morgantown, Monogalia County, [West] Virginia, May 7, 1792
Letter from Universalist Society in Boston, May 12, 1792. Printed in part in Eddy, Universalism in America, Vol. 1, pp. 349-351
Letter from Universalist Church in Georges Hill, Allegania [sic] County, Maryland, May 14, 1792
Letter from Universalist Church in Kingwood, New Jersey, May 14, 1792
Letter from Universalist Society in Drummond Town, Accomack County, Virginia, May 15, 1792
Letter from Universalist Church in Pittsgrove, New Jersey, May 19, 1792
Letter from Universalist Church in Cape May, New Jersey, May 20, 1792
Letter from Universalist Church in Newbritain, Pennsylvania, May 24, 1792
Rules of government for Convention, May 25, 1792
Report to committee to select and publish a collection of hymns, c. May 25, 1792. Similar to report given in minutes in Convention Record Book.
Copy of letter sent by the Convention to the Universalist Church in Georges Hill, Maryland, May 27, 1792. Printed in part in Eddy, Universalism in America, Vol. 1, pp. 386-389
Copy of letter by James Moore to the Universalist Church in Pike Run, Pennsylvania, May 27, 1792. Printed in Eddy, Universalism in America, Vol. 1, pp. 389- 192
Copy of letter from Convention to Universalist Society in Boston, post- May 28, 1792
Letter from Universalist Church in Pike Run, Pennsylvania, May 6, 1793
Letter from Universalist Church in Wrightstown (Oldmans Creek), New Jersey, May 15, 1793
Letter from Universalist Church in Kingwood, New Jersey, May 15, 1793
Letter from Universalist Church in Upper Freehold, New Jersey, May 18, 1793
Letter from Universalist Church in Pittsgrove, New Jersey, May 19, 1793
Letter from Universalist Church in Cape May, New Jersey, May 20, 1793
Letter from Universalist Church in Shilo, New Jersey, May 22, 1793
Letter from Universalist Society in Philadelphia,May 22, 1793
Minutes of Convention, May 25, 27-28, 1793. This may be a draft of the minutes which appear in the Convention Record Book
Copy of letter to Universalist Society in Boston, post-May 25, 1793
Copy of circular letter approved by Convention, October 26, 1796.
Letter from Universalist Church in Newbritain, Pennsylvania, May 20, 1798.
Letter from Universalist Church in New Hanover, Burlington County, New Jersey, May 22, 1798
Letter from Universalist Church in Philadelphia, May 24, 1801
Copy of circular letter approved by Convention, May 26, 1801
Letter from Universalist Church in Plemouth [sic], Luzerne County, Pennsylvania, May 18, 1802
Letter from Universalist Church in Newbritain, Pennsylvania, May 23, 1802
Letter from Universalist Church in Philadelphia, May 23, 1802
Letter from Universalist Church in Philadelphia, May 15, 1803
Letter from Universalist Church in Newbritain, Pennsylvania, May 22, 1803
Minutes of Convention, May 25-26, 1803. Perhaps a draft of the minutes which appear in the Convention Record Book
Letter from Universalist Church in Newbritain, Pennsylvania, May 19, 1805
Letter from Universalist Church in Philadelphia, May 19, 1805
Minutes of Convention, May 25, 27, 1805. A draft, with variations of the minutes which appear in the Convention Record Book

Copy of letter, in hand of James Moore, probably sent to Abner Osburn, Frederick County, Virginia,March 10, 1791. Concerns the securing of Duncan McLain, then minister in Virginia, as minister of the Universalist Church in Philadelphia
Copy of letter in hand of James Moore, probably to George Richards, March 14, 1792. This letter concerns an effort to secure Richards as minister of the Universalist Church in Philadelphia
Convention Book. Contains the minutes and transactions of the Philadelphia Convention, 1790 to 1807.
